measured_by: MacArthur Scale of Subjective Social Status
justification: "Participants indicated their rank on the MacArthur Scale of Subjective Social Status (Adler et al., 2000)."
"We asked participants to rate the event ... We adapted these questions from the Daily Inventory of Stressful Events (Almeida et al., 2002)."
During off-boarding, participants reported "their life satisfaction (Cheung & Lucas, 2014)", which references the validated single-item life-satisfaction scale.
The off-boarding survey assessed "their sense of control (Lachman & Weaver, 1998)", indicating use of the Sense of Control scale developed by Lachman & Weaver.
Participants reported "their time and risk preferences (Falk et al., 2016)", referring to the Preference Survey Module instrument.
The same sentence notes that risk preferences were measured using the Preference Survey Module (Falk et al., 2016).
Off-boarding included "their trust in people (Rosenberg, 1956)", pointing to Rosenberg’s generalized trust scale.
